doc:
Eleanor Robson Belmont https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eleanor_Robson_Belmont 0 Eleanor Robson Belmont (13 December 1879 – 24 October 1979) was an English actress and prominent public figure in the United States. George Bernard Shaw wrote Major Barbara for her, but contractual problems prevented her from playing the role. Mrs. Belmont was involved in the Metropolitan Opera Association as the first woman on the board of directors, and she founded the Metropolitan Opera Guild. Eleanor_Robson_Belmont ( 13_December_1879 – 24_October_1979 ) was an_English_actress and prominent_public_figure in the_United_States . George_Bernard_Shaw wrote Major_Barbara for her , but contractual_problems prevented her from playing the_role . Mrs._Belmont was_involved in the_Metropolitan_Opera_Association as the_first_woman on the_board of directors , and she founded the_Metropolitan_Opera_Guild .
